de.iabg.mesh
Interface MeshConnectionModel

All Superinterfaces:
Loggable, Renderable
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultMeshConnectionModel
public interface MeshConnectionModel
extends Loggable, Renderable

This interface declares basic functionality for geometrically connecting two Finite Element Model meshes. This includes the ability to compute the nodal geometric connection between two JMeshPanel objects, import the connection data from different file types, and export the connection data to different file types. The only criterion that must be given is the maximum tolerance between any two connected nodes. This MeshConnectionModel should also be Renderable, meaning that a Java3D scene should be created from the stored data. Ideally, the First Mesh and the Last Mesh should be rendered in the same scene. Then the connected nodal geometry should overlap both of the models, essentially, highlighting them. This MeshConnectionModel should also be Loggable, meaning that for important user-controlled events, log messages should be fired so that the user can have a command history and be able to view the current status of the stored data. There must be methods to access the data for calculations or output. Before output data can be made, queries must be available to check if the data is already stored.

Version:
September 12, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE
